result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Restitution in the amount of $2600.00 to be paid to Accident Funds Holdings Inc. Claim #: 091500000243.
Restitution in the amount of $1542.10 to be paid to the City of Greenfield Police Department. Cash bail to immediately apply. Any remaining funds to be applied to restitution to Accidents Funds Holdings Inc.
Any and all cash confiscated to be paid towards restitution.
*10/15/2018  Amend restitution ordered in the amount of $2600.00 to be paid to Accident Funds Holdings Inc. claim #91500000243 to be amended to $1,378/56.  
*10/15/2018 Decision and Order signed:  the $182.00 in cash seized from the defendant during his arrest shall be returned to him.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other case and sentence, with credit for 93 days time served.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving initial 2 1/2 years if initial confinement.
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
Maintain full time (40 hours /week) employment.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

supervisions.notes:
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

EACH COUNT:  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), all funds to be applied to restitution first, and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other case and sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Restitution letter from Accident Fund Holdings, Inc.

Defendant Kevin A Taylor in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Kevin A Taylor in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. *JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE CONEN*  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State and defense.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to any other case and sentence, with credit for 93 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to any other case and sentence, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR. 

 CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Regularly participate in an HSED or GED program until completed. 
- Maintain full time (40 hours /week) employment.
- Defendant to complete 250 hours of community service for a non-profit organization.
- Defendant may not drive during the first 2 years of extended supervision. Once the defendant has completed the initial 2 years of extended supervision, the defendant may not drive without a valid license. 

Restitution:

State called Chief Officer Dave Patrick from the City of Greenfield to the stand regarding restitution.

Restitution in the amount of $2600.00 to be paid to Accident Funds Holdings Inc. Claim #: 091500000243
Restitution in the amount of $1542.10 to be paid to the City of Greenfield Police Department. Cash bail to immediately apply. Any remaining funds to be applied to restitution to Accidents Funds Holdings Inc. 

Any and all cash confiscated, to be paid towards restitution.

-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), all funds to be applied to restitution first, and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not immediately eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program after serving initial 2 1/2 years if initial confinement.
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Kevin A Taylor in court with Attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Kevin A Taylor in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for return on warrant and a plea hearing.  As to plea:  AS TO COUNTS #1 AND #2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT #2:    Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.
 
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms or any body armour. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Matter set for sentencing on April 19, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
The Court ordered the $2,500 cash bond forfeited and stayed with recompense to be determined at the end of the case.
